system.description: The true wonder seeker, these mages are the philosophers of the world, always seeking out more knowledge and more wisdom. The Storm Mage is a logician, a tactical intellectual who prefers to neutralize opponents rather than destroy them. Often cold, the Storm Mage is also tumultuous and crafty. If you are playing a Storm Mage, be curious, hungry for information, always in the clouds, tricky and clever, eluding rather than confronting.

overview.base: You may rotate between storm rotator spells during a short rest instead of a long rest.
overview.proficient: You are fluent in Storm Rotators. (This does not make you fluent in the spells themselves.)

overview.base: When you attack with Lightning Ray or Ice Ball, you may target an additional creature or the same creature twice. Any costs you pay must be paid twice and be the same for both attacks These incur attack penalties as though they were two separate attacks.
overview.fluent: You may instead choose up to 1 + F additional or repeated targets.

overview.base: Add Reflect Magic and Teleport to your list of possible rotator spells.

In addition to the custom rotator spells you create, you can learn spells created by others. When you come across a fully created spell using only words you are fluent in, can make a DC 12 + OP INT feat save to attempt to learn it. If you succeed, you can add it to your rotator spell list. If you fail, you are incapable of attempting to learn that spell again. The GM may modify the DC based on the spell's complexity, your knowledge of the spell, any special training you receive, if the spell's creator is there to assist you, or for any other factors they see fit. You may also attempt to learn words that you come across as long as they are of elements you are fluent in. The GM may adjust the DC for these as they see fit as well, but the default is DC 15 + OP INT feat save.
overview.proficient: You are fluent in Elder Sorcery Creation, Celestial Elder Sorcery Words, and Storm Elder Sorcery Words.

results.save: You learn the spell or word.
results.fail: You are incapable of attempting to learn that spell or word again.

overview.base: You gain Limited Spell Strike.

Once per short rest, you may cast a ritual storm spell in half the time it would normally take. Additionally, once per long rest, you may cast a storm spell as though you were adept at it.

You also gain the Bouncy and Illusive casting styles.
overview.proficient: You may now use the benefits from Storm Disciplines P times per long rest.
overview.fluent: You may now use the benefits from Storm Disciplines F times per short rest.

overview.base: Target spell fizzles, as do any others cast simultaneously within range. Their casters take the spells' effects instead.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, the range of Reflect Magic increases by 15 feet.
system.requirements: Target is a conjured spell.
system.trigger: A conjured spell is used within range.

overview.base: Target takes the "on hit" effect of a conjured missile spell that you are proficient in. If the triggering hit was a critical hit, then the target takes the "on critical hit" effect instead.

system.trigger: You have just landed a hit with a weapon or bite attack on another creature and the effect has successfully applied.
system.limitation: Only usable with Lightning Ray and Ice Ball.

overview.base:
You may choose a new target for the spell. All attack rolls, feat saves, and other dice rolls or effects are re-rolled or re-calculated as if the spell was cast on the new target. The range of the spell remains unchanged, but is calculated from the new target instead of from you.
Note: If the spell was heightened, or you spent any other costs on the spell, those remain unchanged and do not need to be re-spent.

system.trigger: The target of a spell does not get affected by your spell.

overview.base: Target creature is moved to a location you have studied within your level in miles. You can study locations by performing this ritual on an area you are in over the course of a long rest. This location must be a static part of the environment, not a moving location like a wagon or ship. If the location substantially changes beyond recognition, your ritual will fail to transport creatures there. You can only have 2 location studied at a time.
overview.proficient: You may now have 2 P locations studied and can teleport a distance of up to P your level in miles.
overview.fluent: You may now have 2 F locations studied and can teleport a distance of up to F your level in miles.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, your maximum teleport distance increases by your level in miles.

overview.base: The triggering spell appears to be a different ability of the same delivery. This is a minor illusion.

system.endCondition: You ar no longer casting the triggering spell.
system.trigger: You are casting a spell.
